required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A New Measurement of Anseikonia Tolerance
clinical_study.official_title: Can we Measure Aniseikonia Tolerance in a Normal Population

brief_summary.textblock:
Population 1:
Measure the effect of size glasses from1-9% on stereopsis
Population 2:
Measure the effect of size glasses from 1-9% on stereopsis in two settings:
- before and after cataract surgery
- after dilation of the eye

detailed_description.textblock:
Population 1:
21 eye healthy phakic individuals. Measurements: baseline stereopsis and stereopsis after size glass (1-9%) is added in front of the right eye and in front og the left eye. This measurement provides details on how much size difference a person can endure without impairing stereopsis.
Population 2:
11 phakic eye healthy individuals awaiting cataract operation on both eyes. Measurements are the same as population 1 but this study group is also measured after dilating the eyes. This is to see if accommodation affects the measurement. A postoperative measurement six weeks after cataract operation is also performed to examine if cataract operation affects the measurement.

primary_outcome.description: How many percent aniseikonia is tolerated before stereopsis is impaired. Measured by first measuring baseline stereopsis and here after adding aniseikonic (size glass) from 1-9% in front of the right and left eye to measure if stereopsis is impaired. If stereopsis is impaired at 4% sizeglas then aniseikonia tolerance is 4%.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Aniseikonia tolerance after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of aniseikonia tolerance before and after surgery. Measurement: before and after surgery stereopsis is measured, hereafter aniseikonic glasses (size glass) from 1-9% is added in front of the right and left eye to see if stereopsis is impaired. If stereopsis is impaired with 3% aniseikonic glass then the tolerance is 3%. After surgery the measurement is repeated to examine if the aniseikonia tolerance is the same.

arm_group.description: 21 eyehealthy individuals examined for baseline stereopsis and impact of aniseikonia on stereopsis. An non-invasive measurement.

11 patients awaiting cataract surgery on both eyes. Measurement of baseline stereopsis and impact of artificial induced aniseikonia on stereopsis. A non invasive measurement that are repeated after dilatation of the eyes and again six weeks after surgery.

intervention.description: Adding sizeglasses of different percent before right and left eye and measure the impact on stereopsis

study_pop.textblock: group 1: eyehealthy pahkic individuls group 2: eyehalthy phakic patients awainting cataratc surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- No previous eye history
- cataract grade <= 1
- visual acuity above 0.8
Exclusion Criteria:
- lack of cooperation
- amblyopia
- axial anisometropia
- ametropia
